question: In many developing countries, there is an increasing movement of workers from rural areas into the cities. Why do you think this happens? What problems can this cause?
text: The working habits have changed quite a lot in the past years. Usually one worked at the same place all his life while in the new generations it is common to be more polyvalent. In the further essay, I will explain the main reasons why it happens and some solutions from companies to keep their workers. Likewise, education increased drastically in the last decades. Schools and Universities are no longer just for the wealthy.

First, in my opinion, the majority of the population has more skills and pursue to achieve higher professional positions. With this in mind, the new generations are in constant research for a better career and do not accept being paid under their value. For example, someone who has a master is expecting to evolve and gain more money over the years. Therefore, in case it is not happening, young people nowadays are not afraid of change.

Nonetheless, companies can stimulate their workers in order to keep them. If they make them feel accomplished they will have no apparent reason to swish. Such as, making them feel independent and in control of some projects. Besides, creating a good relationship between the team will create a healthy work environment instead of stimulating criticism or, toxic competition.

To conclude, most people have an extensive range of knowledge in our times and no longer believe in only one job. It is predictable a career that varies from different activities like having multiple income sources. Briefly, enterprises must be prepared for rotativity.
